items.content_html:
From a discussion here: w3c/csswg-drafts#7753 (comment)

The CSS @font-face rule was missing some bits of information:

  • multiple src strings can be specified. However only the last one declared is used - or actually the last one that contains a resource that can be loaded.
  • This is not the recommended way to provide fallbacks - we want people to use a single directive with comma separated list of resources as fallbacks, listed in "preferred loading order".
  • But some browsers will fail if they don't understand any element, wiping out the whole descriptor. So we have no choice but to note the user of multiple src to fix this problem. The discussion above indicated "some browsers" don't do the right thing, but actually "doing it right" is quite recent.

I also added a BCD entry for the issue with some browsers not handling invalid items: mdn/browser-compat-data#18454

There are some other issues with this docs discussed below. I don't plan on addressing them - since they are larger.
items.title: Add implications multiple src and invalid elements

items.content_html:
Description

This adds a "Security" section to Map-Object comparison. The section mentions that Object may be unsafe as a key-value store with user-provided keys and values, and links to an article with more details.

Motivation

Based on this article, which is also linked from the eval() page, using Object as a key-value store for arbitrary user-provided input may be unsafe, because the user could change the object's prototype. This isn't an issue with Map.

This isn't yet mentioned in the Map-Object comparison, but it might be useful to help readers avoid writing potentially unsafe code.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Add `Security` section to Map-Object comparison

Dependabot will merge this PR once CI passes on it, as requested by @mdn-bot.

Dependabot commands and options

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR:

  • @dependabot rebase will rebase this PR
  • @dependabot recreate will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it
  • @dependabot merge will merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot squash and merge will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot cancel merge will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging
  • @dependabot reopen will reopen this PR if it is closed
  • @dependabot close will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually
  • @dependabot ignore this major version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this minor version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this dependency will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

items.content_html:
Description

Added commas to offset the ancestor phrase and added the word element after <dfn>.

Motivation

I found it confusing the first time I read it.

I personally would have rewritten the sentence to be: The text enclosed by either the <p> element, the <dt>/<dd> pairing, or the <section> element is considered the definition of the term. But I chose to do less than more.

Additional details

MDN Link: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/dfn

Related issues and pull requests

NA
items.title: Added commas and word in 2nd sentence

items.content_html:
Description

Clearly list the recommended initialization vector sizes for AES-CBC (16 bytes) and AES-GCM (12 bytes). The existing docs use the language "Must be 16 bytes," implying this is true for both cbc/gcm, but that is incorrect.

Motivation

To be consistent with official recommendations and the remainder of the documentation which shows 12 bytes for GCM.
items.title: Clarify initialization vector sizes in subtlecrypto docs

items.content_html:
Description

There is significant overlapping between the different class feature references, because indeed, the static, public fields, and private features pages are orthogonal and result in a lot of possible combinations. In this PR, I'm separating each feature to be documented in one page, with sufficient cross-linking between.

I'm not introducing any extra content in this PR, but I will be in follow-ups. This PR ensures I know where to put each feature's documentation.

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: More logical division of various class element features

items.content_html:
Description

This PR aims to complete the reference docs for the https://wicg.github.io/layout-instability/ API. It also integrates it into the rest of the Performance API docs per our plan to have all Performance APIs in one group and at a central place.

Motivation

openwebdocs/project#62

Additional details

I was thinking about a checklist for what to do when documenting a new Performance API. I haven't come too far on that.

  • Update the main Performance_API page
  • Update the diagram
  • Mention the new API in the PerformanceEntry interface and update its sub pages.
  • Update GroupData to add new interfaces to the "Performance" group
  • Add new reference pages with the sidebar {{APIRef("Performance API")}}
  • Add a chapter to the guide (TBD)
  • Add new glossary pages for new metric name (if any)

Related issues and pull requests

None.
items.title: Document Layout Instability API
